recipe_name: Crisp goats' cheese, herb and tomato salad
author: Nick Nairn
method: Preheat the grill to its highest setting. When hot, place the cheese slices onto a baking tray and grill for 1-2 minutes on each side, or until golden-brown and crisp on both sides. Mix the onion, tomato and coriander together in a bowl, drizzle over the olive oil and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Mix well to coat in the oil.  To serve, place the salad in the middle of a serving plate and arrange the crisp goats' cheese rounds on top.
ingredients: 150g/5½oz goats' cheese, sliced into four rounds,  ½ onion, finely sliced,  1 tomato, chopped,  1 small handful fresh coriander, chopped,  2 tbsp olive oil,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
